Description: Establish the core development environment, repository structure, and deployment pipelines for a stable and scalable project foundation.
Definition of Done: All foundational systems are operational and documented

Description: Initialize the monorepo with all top-level directories and configuration files. This includes setting up .gitignore, .editorconfig, licensing, and placeholder directories for Docs/, Infra/, Backend/, and Frontend/.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Repository can be cloned successfully
- All top-level folders (Docs/, Infra/, Backend/, Frontend/, .github/) exist
- .gitignore is configured for Python, Node.js, and environment files
- A basic README.md file is present with project description and setup instructions
Definition of Done:
- Monorepo structure created and pushed to version control
- All configuration files in place
- Team can successfully clone and access the repository
Technical Notes: This is a "day zero" task. Keep it simple and focused on structure, not implementation.

Description: Set up the foundational FastAPI application with configuration management, structured logging, and error handling. Create the core application structure without any business logic.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Running uvicorn app.main:app starts a server without errors
- GET /health returns a 200 OK status with JSON payload {"status": "ok"}
- GET /version returns the current project version
- Application configuration loaded from .env file using Pydantic
- Logging implemented in structured format (JSON) with request IDs
Definition of Done:
- Backend server runs without errors
- Health and version endpoints functional
- Configuration management working
- Structured logging operational
Technical Notes: Focus on making the backend "alive" and observable from the start

Description: Implement the complete database schema as defined in the data model. Create and run idempotent SQL migration scripts in the Infra/supabase/ folder to create all tables (locations, ai_logs, tasks, training_data, category_icon_map) with correct columns, data types, constraints, and indexes.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Running migration script on fresh Supabase project creates all tables successfully
- All defined columns and constraints (PRIMARY KEY, UNIQUE on place_id) are present
- Basic indexes exist on foreign keys and frequently queried columns (state, category, next_check_at)
- Backend can establish database connection and perform simple SELECT 1 query
Definition of Done:
- All database tables created with proper constraints
- Migration scripts are idempotent and tested
- Backend can connect and query database successfully
Technical Notes: The 0001_init.sql file is the single source of truth for database structure

Description: Initialize the chosen frontend (React + Vite) with basic component structure, build tooling, and configuration that points to the backend API. The app should display a simple "Hello World" page.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Running npm run dev starts local development server
- Running npm run build creates production-ready build without errors
- Frontend can read API base URL from environment variable (VITE_API_BASE_URL)
- Basic App.tsx component renders a page title
Definition of Done:
- Frontend development server runs
- Production build succeeds
- Environment configuration working
- Basic component structure in place
Technical Notes: This story is agnostic to UI library; focused on making frontend toolchain work

Description: Automatically and legally discover potential Turkish-oriented business candidates from Google APIs and store them in the system.
Definition of Done: Data discovery pipeline is operational and compliant

Description: Build a robust, quota-efficient service (google_service.py) that wraps the Google Places API (Nearby Search and Text Search). The service must handle API errors, respect rate limits, and use field masks to request only necessary data.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Given latitude, longitude, and radius, service returns list of places
- Given text query (e.g., "Turkse bakkerij Rotterdam"), service returns list of places
- Service implements exponential backoff for retrying failed requests
- All API calls logged for auditing and cost tracking
Definition of Done:
- Google Places API integration working
- Error handling and retry logic implemented
- Comprehensive logging in place
- Field masks used for quota efficiency
Technical Notes: This is a core, reusable service. Focus on stability and efficiency.

Description: Implement the discovery_bot.py worker. It should read configuration of target cities (starting with Rotterdam) and categories, execute grid-based search using Google Service, and insert new, deduplicated candidates into locations table with state CANDIDATE.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Bot can be run manually from command line
- Processes at least 3 different business categories for Rotterdam
- Successfully deduplicates results based on place_id before insertion
- After run, locations table contains ~500 new records with state = 'CANDIDATE'
Definition of Done:
- DiscoveryBot executable and functional
- Grid-based search working for Rotterdam
- Deduplication logic implemented
- 500+ candidate records in database
Technical Notes: Deduplication is critical to avoid wasting API calls and processing power

Description: Use AI to intelligently filter, categorize, and enrich candidate businesses, moving them to a verified state.
Definition of Done: AI classification and verification system is operational and accurate

Summary: OpenAI Service with Structured JSON Output
Description: Build the openai_service.py that handles communication with OpenAI API. The service must enforce JSON schema on AI output, handle retries, and log all interactions for cost and quality analysis in ai_logs table.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Service can send prompt and receive valid JSON response conforming to predefined Pydantic model
- If AI returns invalid JSON, service retries request (up to limit)
- Every AI call recorded in ai_logs table with input, output, and model used
Definition of Done:
- OpenAI integration working with JSON schema validation
- Retry logic for invalid responses implemented
- Comprehensive AI logging in place
Technical Notes: Reliability of AI interaction is key. Invalid JSON should be exception, not rule.

Description: Implement the classify AI task. It should take candidate's name, address, and type and determine: a) if relevant to Turkish diaspora (keep/ignore), b) its primary category (e.g., bakery, restaurant).
Acceptance Criteria:
- Classification prompt includes few-shot examples with clear Dutch/Turkish patterns
- On test set of 100 manually labeled candidates, classification precision ≥ 90%
- Output successfully validated against JSON schema
- Candidate's category and confidence_score updated in database based on result
Definition of Done:
- AI classification working with 90%+ precision
- Category assignment functional
- Confidence scoring implemented
- JSON validation operational
Technical Notes: This is the first major quality gate. Prompt engineering here is critical.

Description: Build a fast, intuitive, and mobile-friendly web application for end-users to discover Turkish-oriented businesses.
Definition of Done: Frontend application is functional, performant, and user-friendly

Description: Implement the MapView component using Leaflet. It should display map of Netherlands, centered on default location or user's position, with markers for verified locations.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Map loads correctly with OpenStreetMap or similar tile layer
- Markers displayed on map for locations fetched from GET /api/v1/locations endpoint
- Clicking marker displays popup with location's name and category
- Map performance smooth with up to 200 markers
Definition of Done:
- Map component rendering correctly
- Markers displaying for verified locations
- Popup functionality working
- Performance optimized for 200+ markers
Technical Notes: This is the primary visual interface for the app

Description: Build the LocationList and LocationCard components. The list should display locations, be sortable by distance and rating, and filterable by category. The card should show all key information.
Acceptance Criteria:
- List displays location name, address, category, rating, and status badge
- Users can filter list by selecting one or more categories
- Users can sort list by "Distance" or "Rating"
- List and map synchronized; clicking list item highlights corresponding marker on map
Definition of Done:
- Location list and card components functional
- Filtering and sorting working
- Map-list synchronization implemented
Technical Notes: This provides an alternative, accessible way to browse data

Description: Ensure the data remains accurate and up-to-date through automated monitoring and re-verification processes.
Definition of Done: Monitoring system ensures data remains fresh and accurate

Description: Implement the monitor_bot.py worker. It should periodically select records where next_check_at is in the past, based on defined Freshness Policy. It then re-triggers verification process for these records.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Bot correctly calculates next_check_at for new records based on confidence and status
- Bot processes records in batches (e.g., MONITOR_MAX_PER_RUN=200)
- After run, no record in database has next_check_at older than 90 days
- Changes to location's business_status detected and updated
Definition of Done:
- MonitorBot operational
- Freshness policy implemented and working
- Automatic re-verification functioning
- Data quality maintained over time
Technical Notes: This is the "heartbeat" of the application, ensuring long-term data quality

Description: Provide tools for administrators to manually correct data, add gold records, and manage the system.
Definition of Done: Admin system allows manual data correction and management

Description: Build admin-only API endpoints and simple UI to allow admins to manually create, edit, and correct location records. Manually added records should be flagged as "gold" in training_data table.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Admin can add new location with all core fields, immediately set to VERIFIED
- Admin can edit any field of existing location
- All manual actions logged for audit purposes
- Manually added/verified records stored as gold records for LearningBot
Definition of Done:
- Admin CRUD operations functional
- Audit logging implemented
- Gold record system working
Technical Notes: This is the "human-in-the-loop" mechanism for continuous improvement

Description: Security & Hardening
Epic Link: Make the system reliable, secure, and production-ready with monitoring, alerts, and compliance checks.
Technical Notes: System is secure, observable, and production-ready

Description: Implement metrics collection system that tracks key KPIs: new candidates per week, conversion rate to VERIFIED, task error rates, API latency. Set up basic alerting for critical failures.
Definition of Done:
- Metrics dashboard displays at least 5 core metrics
- Alert triggered when task failure rate exceeds 10% in 1-hour period
- Alert triggered when Google API returns burst of 429 status codes
Technical Notes:
- Metrics system operational
- Alerting configured and tested
- KPI tracking in place
Components: You can't manage what you can't measure. Essential for production.

Description: Prepare the MVP for its first real-world test, gather feedback, and plan for the next phase.
Definition of Done: MVP is successfully deployed and ready for user testing

Description: Deploy entire integrated system (Backend, Frontend, Database, Cron Jobs) to production environment. Execute full, automated cycle from discovery to verification for Rotterdam.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Public URL for frontend is live and accessible
- Application has ≥200 VERIFIED locations in Rotterdam with ratings and websites
- All automated bots (Discovery, Verification, Monitor) running on schedule without human intervention
- Application loads in under 2 seconds on mobile 3G connection
Definition of Done:
- Full system deployed and operational
- 200+ verified locations in production
- Automated pipeline working
- Performance targets met
Technical Notes: This is the "go-live" story. The success criteria for MVP are met here.
